meanings.definition: Not feeling or showing sympathy or compassion.
meanings.sent1: The unsympathetic teacher didn't comfort the crying student.
meanings.sent2: She was unsympathetic towards her friend's loss.
meanings.sent3: The unsympathetic cat ignored its owner's pleas for attention.
meanings.sent4: The unsympathetic storm raged on, indifferent to the damage it caused.
meanings.sent5: The unsympathetic judge handed out a harsh sentence without a second thought.

meanings.definition: Not agreeing with or supporting someone or something.
meanings.sent1: His unsympathetic views clashed with the majority opinion.
meanings.sent2: The unsympathetic neighbor refused to sign the petition.
meanings.sent3: The unsympathetic alarm clock refused to stop ringing, no matter how many times it was hit.
meanings.sent4: The unsympathetic wall stood firm, blocking any attempts to pass through.
meanings.sent5: The unsympathetic computer program kept displaying error messages, frustrating the user.
